summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, documenting that inmate Jeffery Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell after an apparent suicide attempt by hanging on July 23, 2019. The report details the response by staff and the removal of a homemade rope from his neck.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the incident report; found unresponsive in his cell after an apparent suicide attempt by hanging.

persons.name: Tartagrione
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate who alerted staff at the door, stating that Epstein had attempted to hang himself.

connections.description: Were housed together in cell 124 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffery Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell (SHU Miler Cell 124) with an orange homemade rope around his neck, after an apparent hanging attempt. Staff removed the rope and he was breathing but unresponsive.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
SHU Miler Cell 124 (Special Housing Unit, MCC New York)
keyFacts: Jeffery Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM after an apparent suicide attempt by hanging.
Epstein's cell mate, Tartagrione, alerted staff to the incident.
Staff removed an orange homemade rope from Epstein's neck; he was breathing but unresponsive.
The incident is officially classified as 'Self-Mutilation' under prohibited act code 228.
The report is a formal Bureau of Prisons document initiating the disciplinary process following the incident.
